text: Match the following Cyber Security practices to their terms.

answers.text: Update software to close vulnerabilities and shut down bugs.
Train employees to be vigilant.
Cultivate an environment that encourages honesty with regards to cyber security problems.
Schedule deep scans and when in doubt, use quick scans.
answers.matching: Leverage Traditional and New Antivirus Software

answers.text: Have resources available for responding to breaches.
answers.matching: Keep Cyber Security Resources at Hand

matching_list: Keep Cyber Security Resources at Hand
Leverage Traditional and New Antivirus Software

text: The statement "Individuals who work to exploit vulnerabilities in a computer system, sometimes for information gathering, protest or theft" defines which one of the following threats?
The term Authentication is defined by which of the following statements?

answers.answer_text: The process of determining whether a computer system user is who he or she claims to be
A means to enhance digital security.
The ability to recover lost data.

text: Match the following definitions to the correct cyber attack.

answers.text: A type of application that can gain unauthorised access or cause damage to a computer or computer system.
Conversation monitoring, whether by listening in on a room, tapping into a landline or cell phone, or intercepting an email.
Exploiting vulnerabilities in a computer system, sometimes for information gathering, protest or theft.
Intercepting the communication between two parties in an attempt to spy on the victims, steal credentials or personal information,
The act of pretending to be something or someone you are not in order to gain access to sensitive information.
A cyber-attack where an attacker tries to guess, or crack a user’s password.
The act of modifying devices
Maliciously written codes that alter how a computer operates and can damage the computer and data stored on i
A method that locks data systems or individual devices.
An attacker essentially floods a target server with traffic in an attempt to disrupt, and perhaps even bring down the target.
An attempt to acquire sensitive or valuable information by pretending to represent a legitimate organisation or person, often someone of authority.
A more sophisticated form of a phishing attack in which cybercriminals target only privileged users such as system administrators and C-suite executives

text: Which of the following terms can be defined as "a requirement of more than one method to validate an user"
"The process by which data is scrambled and encoded to make it unintelligible" is which of the following?
The following statement "A password that works for only one network session or transaction" defines which of the following terms.
A data security management plan includes which of the following? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Ensuring the data is not accessed by unauthorised users.
Verifying and Updating the plan's components.
The effective oversight of the organisation.

text:
The “cyber kill chain” is a sequence of stages required for an attacker to successfully infiltrate a network and exfiltrate data from it.

Order the stages of a "cyber kill chain".

answers.text: Stage 1
Stage 2
Stage 3
Stage 4

text: Which of the following best defines the security incident "Improper Usage"?

answers.answer_text: An attack executed via an email message or attachment (e.g. malware infection).
Any incident resulting from violation of an organization’s acceptable usage policies by an authorized user.
An attack that employs brute force methods to compromise, degrade, or destroy systems, networks, or services
The loss or theft of a computing device or media used by the organization, such as a laptop or smartphone.

text: Match the following security incidents to the correct recommended action.

answers.text: Remediate any infections as quickly as possible before they progress.
Configure your critical systems to record all privileged escalation events and set alarms for unauthorized privilege escalation attempts.
Identify the privileged user accounts for all domains, servers, apps, and critical devices and ensure that monitoring is enabled for all systems
Detect, monitor and investigate unauthorized access attempts – with priority on those that are mission-critical and/or contain sensitive data.

text: Which of the following incident types aligns to the "Exploitation and Installation" Stage of the cyber kill chain? (Select all that are applicable).
Match the source of cyber security threats to the correct definition.

answers.text: Groups that use phishing, spam, spyware, and malware to conduct identity theft, online fraud, and system extortion to infiltrate systems or networks for financial gain.

Groups that conduct cyber attacks to destroy, infiltrate, or exploit critical infrastructure to threaten national security, compromise military equipment, disrupt the economy, and cause mass casualties.
Groups or individuals that carry out cyberattacks in support of political causes rather than financial gain.

Employees, third-party vendors, contractors, or other business associates who have legitimate access to enterprise assets but misuse that accesses to steal or destroy information for financial or personal gain.
Individuals who conduct industrial or business espionage to either make a profit or disrupt a competitor’s business by attacking critical infrastructure, stealing trade secrets, and gaining access.

text: Which of the following are some best practices to protect from cyber security? (Select all that are applicable).

answers.answer_text: Provide access to sensitive information to all employees.

text: Match the following common incidents to the correct response strategy.

answers.text: Quarantine the malicious email from all accounts on the system. Be sure no one can access the email from anywhere on your network until it is reviewed by an administrator.
Change passwords of all accounts and block email access from countries where employees won’t be logging in.
Contain and eradicate. Disconnect the computer from the network, but don’t power the device off. Work through the system and eradicate any malicious files or applications.
